Key Match Events: Tyler Stephenson drove home the gameâ€™s first run with a single and scored when Ty France turned on a hanging curveball for a two-run shot.
Elly De La Cruz got a slider that caught too much of the plate and yanked it down the right-field line for a no-doubt, three-run homer that traveled an estimated 423 feet.
Post-Match Reflections: Pittsburgh Pirates manager Derek Shelton said of Jared Jones' performance: 'Terrible. Everything was terrible today.'
Manager Shelton noted the challenges Jones faced, including inconsistency and a recent injury, and emphasized the importance of finishing strong in the season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in high temperatures in Cincinnati.
Bryan Reynolds was tied with Brendan Donovan for the most hits (14) against the Reds this year.
Others: The Pirates and Reds were set to play again the next day.
Probable pitchers for the next game included RHP Paul Skenes for the Pirates and RHP Hunter Greene for the Reds.
